001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import java.awt.Point;
004import java.util.LinkedList;
005import java.util.List;
006import squidpony.annotation.Beta;
007
008/**
009 * Contains methods to draw antialiased lines based on floating point
010 * coordinates.
011 *
012 * Because of the way this line is calculated, endpoints may be swapped and
013 * therefore the list may not be in start-to-end order.
014 *
015 * Based on work by Hugo Elias at
016 * http://freespace.virgin.net/hugo.elias/graphics/x_wuline.htm which is in turn
017 * base on work by Wu.
018 *
019 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
020 */
021@Beta
022public class Elias {
023
024    static private List<Point> path;
025    static private float[][] lightMap;
026    static private int width, height;
027
028    private Elias() {
029    }
030
031    public synchronized static float[][] lightMap(double startx, double starty, double endx, double endy) {
032        line(startx, starty, endx, endy);
033        return lightMap;
034    }
035
036    /**
037     * Gets the line between the two points.
038     *
039     * @param startx
040     * @param starty
041     * @param endx
042     * @param endy
043     * @return
044     */
045    public synchronized static List<Point> line(double startx, double starty, double endx, double endy) {
046        path = new LinkedList<>();
047        width = (int) (Math.max(startx, endx) + 1);
048        height = (int) (Math.max(starty, endy) + 1);
049        lightMap = new float[width][height];
050        runLine(startx, starty, endx, endy);
051        return path;
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * Marks the location as having the visibility given.
056     *
057     * @param x
058     * @param y
059     * @param c
060     */
061    private static void mark(double x, double y, double c) {
062        //check bounds overflow from antialiasing
063        if (x >= 0 && x < width && y >= 0 && y < height) {
064            path.add(new Point((int) x, (int) y));
065            lightMap[(int) x][(int) y] = (float) c;
066        }
067    }
068
069    private static double trunc(double x) {
070        if (x < 0) {
071            return Math.ceil(x);
072        } else {
073            return Math.floor(x);
074        }
075    }
076
077    private static double frac(double x) {
078        return x - trunc(x);
079    }
080
081    private static double invfrac(double x) {
082        return 1 - frac(x);
083    }
084
085    private static void runLine(double startx, double starty, double endx, double endy) {
086        double x1 = startx, y1 = starty, x2 = endx, y2 = endy;
087        double grad, xd, yd, length, xm, ym, xgap, ygap, xend, yend, xf, yf, brightness1, brightness2;
088        int x, y, ix1, ix2, iy1, iy2;
089        boolean shallow = false;
090
091        xd = x2 - x1;
092        yd = y2 - y1;
093
094        if (Math.abs(xd) > Math.abs(yd)) {
095            shallow = true;
096        }
097
098        if (!shallow) {
099            double temp = x1;
100            x1 = y1;
101            y1 = temp;
102            temp = x2;
103            x2 = y2;
104            y2 = temp;
105            xd = x2 - x1;
106            yd = y2 - y1;
107        }
108        if (x1 > x2) {
109            double temp = x1;
110            x1 = x2;
111            x2 = temp;
112            temp = y1;
113            y1 = y2;
114            y2 = temp;
115            xd = x2 - x1;
116            yd = y2 - y1;
117        }
118
119        grad = yd / xd;
120
121        //add the first end point
122        xend = trunc(x1 + .5);
123        yend = y1 + grad * (xend - x1);
124
125        xgap = invfrac(x1 + .5);
126
127        ix1 = (int) xend;
128        iy1 = (int) yend;
129
130        brightness1 = invfrac(yend) * xgap;
131        brightness2 = frac(yend) * xgap;
132
133        if (shallow) {
134            mark(ix1, iy1, brightness1);
135            mark(ix1, iy1 + 1, brightness2);
136        } else {
137            mark(iy1, ix1, brightness1);
138            mark(iy1 + 1, ix1, brightness2);
139        }
140
141        yf = yend + grad;
142
143        //add the second end point
144        xend = trunc(x2 + .5);
145        yend = y2 + grad * (xend - x2);
146
147        xgap = invfrac(x2 - .5);
148
149        ix2 = (int) xend;
150        iy2 = (int) yend;
151
152        brightness1 = invfrac(yend) * xgap;
153        brightness2 = frac(yend) * xgap;
154
155        if (shallow) {
156            mark(ix2, iy2, brightness1);
157            mark(ix2, iy2 + 1, brightness2);
158        } else {
159            mark(iy2, ix2, brightness1);
160            mark(iy2 + 1, ix2, brightness2);
161        }
162
163        //add the in-between points
164        for (x = ix1 + 1; x < ix2; x++) {
165            brightness1 = invfrac(yf);
166            brightness2 = frac(yf);
167
168            if (shallow) {
169                mark(x, (int) yf, brightness1);
170                mark(x, (int) yf + 1, brightness2);
171            } else {
172                mark((int) yf, x, brightness1);
173                mark((int) yf + 1, x, brightness2);
174            }
175
176            yf += grad;
177        }
178    }
179}
